experience.title: Frontend Developer
responsibilities: Work to Plan/Develop/Debug/Improve/Document the various frontend applications (Kiosk, Customer Engagement Center, Monitor, Calendar, Command Center, Reports)
Lead TechRadar session to introduce new tools to the platform and improve developer culture
Overhaul application performance through using Flux patterns
Developed Calendar integration UI to link Outlook Calendar with QLess Calendar
Work with customers and product team to plan new features
Lead trainings with support team to review new UI features
Develop new application UI using KnockoutJS
Collaborate with the backend team to assist with API design
Currently developing Release notes management application so PO can create release notes without having to include it during build phase
Document legacy code base

experience.title: Support Engineer
responsibilities: Troubleshoot the various QLess applications while providing excellent customer service with Zendesk Support
Update customer configurations in the MySQL database
Generating actionable custom reports for customers using the MySQL database
Modify application styles to match customer design language
Troubleshoot application issues by researching logs in Kibana
Configure and troubleshoot SMS services using Twilio
Identify/Reproduce/Escalate bugs to the engineering team
Author application training materials in Zendesk Guide

experience.title: Instructional Technologies Consultant, eLearning
responsibilities: Support campus Learning Management System (Blackboard) to provide support for faculty
Respond to faculty tickets to resolve LMS issues via ServiceNow
Assist faculty in online course redesign and course development
Edit faculty instructional videos
Webmaster for Cal Poly Pomona CSU Symposium at http://www.cpp.edu/~csusymposium

projects.title: Phoney Kiosk
projects.summary: Simple VueJS frontend to rewrite the QLess Kiosk Application to a dynamic form. The original project was built using KnockoutJS, though with this refactor, the codebase would be much slimmer, more accessible, and much easier to test.

projects.title: Montebello Historical Society
projects.summary: I worked as a freelance web developer to redesign and develop the Montebello Historical Society Website to create a more responsive, dynamic, and accessible site.

projects.title: To Do list
projects.summary: This is just a simple todo list app that basically every frontend developer has built at somepoint.
